title: Honda partners with IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay for advanced AI research in automated driving technologies
content: Honda has initiated joint research with IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay to advance its Cooperative Intelligence (CI) technology. This collaboration aims to enhance AI technologies for reducing traffic collisions and enabling automated driving. The research will involve real-world testing in India’s complex traffic environments, leveraging the expertise of IIT researchers and students.

title: California passes requirements on carmakers and domestic violence
content: California lawmakers have approved a proposal requiring automakers to enhance protections for domestic abuse survivors using internet-connected cars. The bill mandates carmakers to establish processes for restraining order submissions and to allow drivers to disable location access. Governor Gavin Newsom will decide on the bill by Sept. 30.

title: CNG, hydrogen, fuel cell tech in ICE 2 wheelers a risk factor: Ather in IPO runup
content: “Developments in alternative technologies in ICE vehicles, such as advanced diesel, hydrogen, ethanol, fuel cells, or compressed natural gas, improvements in the fuel economy or other features of ICE vehicles, or lower cost of gasoline, which lower the total cost of ownership of ICE vehicles,” is a risk factor, according to the draft red herring prospectus filed with markets regulator SEBI.

title: Musk denies report his xAI in talks over Tesla revenue
content: Elon Musk has denied reports that his AI startup xAI has held talks to share future Tesla revenue in exchange for access to xAI's technology. He clarified that while Tesla has benefited from discussions with xAI engineers, there is no need to license anything from xAI. The Wall Street Journal had reported potential revenue-sharing agreements.

title: Tesla shares gain on plans to launch full self-driving in Europe, China
content: Tesla shares increased by 2.5% after the company confirmed plans to launch its Full Self-Driving software in China and Europe, pending regulatory approval. This announcement comes ahead of the unveiling of Tesla's robotaxi product, Cybercab. CEO Elon Musk expects regulatory approval for FSD in these regions by year-end.

title: How India can leverage biofuels to build a sustainable future
content: Derived from renewable resources such as biomass and agricultural waste, biofuels provide a cleaner alternative to conventional fossil fuels in our energy palettes, for meeting needs, whether it is surface mobility, aviation, shipping, or even power production. Today, it is possible to leverage bioenergy to fuel each of these energy needs and that also with lower permanent emissions. India has achieved an avoidance of as much as 1.5 tonnes of GHG emissions per kilolitre of bio-ethanol replacing petrol in our cars, amounting to more than 40 million tonnes of savings in GHG emissions over the last decade.

title: Volvo Cars looks to Nvidia-powered software, 'megacastings' for future EVs
content: Volvo Cars will use a single software system powered by Nvidia chips for all future models and employ megacastings to reduce costs for electric vehicles. Starting with the EX90 model, this approach aims to enhance safety systems and allow over-the-air updates, without focusing on subscription services.

title: Revolutionising road safety with AI: India eyes ADAS technology to slash road accidents
content: The rising percentage of road crashes in the country is alarming for the government of India, OEMs (Original equipment manufacturers), regulatory bodies, and other players, who need to address the concern. Implementing artificial intelligence such as ADAS in vehicles might bring a paradigm shift toward safer vehicles.

title: Gadkari asks state FM's to consider reducing GST on flex-fuel vehicles to 12 %
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged state finance ministers to reduce GST on flex-fuel vehicles to 12%. He emphasized the need to cut fossil fuel imports and boost biofuel use. Currently, GST rates stand at 28% for combustion engine vehicles and 5 percent for electric ones, Gadkari highlighted the potential benefits for agriculture and job creation.
